style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Levi Strauss &amp; Co. (the "Company") issued a press release announcing its </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;financial results. A copy of the press release is attached hereto as Exhibit 99.1.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The information provided in this Item 2.02 shall not be deemed "filed" for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), or incorporated by reference in any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except as shall be expressly set forth by specific reference in such a filing.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="2"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:12%;"></td><td style="width:88%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM&#160;2.05.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Costs Associated with Exit or Disposal Activities.</font></div><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;7, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company committed to a global restructuring initiative designed to reduce costs, streamline operations and support agility. The adverse impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Company's business necessitated cost reduction actions while plans to streamline operations continue to be developed. The initiative includes a reduction in workforce that will result in the elimination of approximately 15% of the Company&#8217;s global non-retail and non-manufacturing positions and is expected to result in approximately $100 million in annual cost savings. The Company expects to substantially complete the restructuring by the end of fiscal year 2020.&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">For the three and six months ended May&#160;24, 2020, the Company recognized restructuring charges of $67.4 million, which primarily relate to severance benefits, based on separation benefits provided by Company policy or statutory benefit plans. Of the total charges incurred, approximately $65.8 million are expected to result in cash expenditures. The Company estimates that it will incur future additional charges related to this restructuring initiative.  Final estimates for headcount, timing and charges in certain areas of the international business are subject to completion of applicable local works council and other consultative processes.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="2"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:12%;"></td><td style="width:88%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM&#160;5.02.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Departure of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers. </font></div><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;7, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company announced that David Love will retire from his position as the Company&#8217;s Executive Vice President &amp; President of Levi Strauss Asia, Middle East and Africa, effective February 1, 2021.&#160;Mr. Love will receive the severance benefits set forth in the Company&#8217;s previously disclosed Senior Executive Severance Plan, filed as Exhibit 10.19 to the Company&#8217;s Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended November 24, 2019.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward Looking Statements</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">This Current Report on Form 8-K contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, including those regarding the expected nature, timing, annualized cost savings, and charges related to the restructuring plan described above. All forward-looking statements are based on management&#8217;s estimates, projections and assumptions as of the date hereof and include the assumptions that underlie such statements. These statements are subject to known and unknown risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed or implied by such statements, including but not limited to: uncertain global and economic market conditions; the Company&#8217;s ability to implement all phases of the restructuring plan as planned; and the possibility that benefits of the program may not materialize as expected. These risks are in addition to the other risks cited in the Company&#8217;s press releases, public statements and/or filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including those identified in the &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; sections of the Company&#8217;s most recently-filed Form 10-Q. The Company undertakes no obligation to revise or update any forward-looking statements.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="2"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:12%;"></td><td style="width:88%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM&#160;9.01.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial Statements and Exhibits.</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(d)&#160;Exhibits.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">99.1 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><a style="text-decoration:underline;color:#0000FF;-sec-extract:exhibit;" href="exhibit991-2q2020pressrele.htm"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Press style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;">Investor-relations@levi.com</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;">newsmediarequests@levi.com</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">LEVI STRAUSS&#160;&amp; CO. REPORTS </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">SECOND</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">-QUARTER </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;FINANCIAL RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:5px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reported Revenues of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$0.5 Billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;were down </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">62 percent</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:5px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Diluted EPS was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$(0.91)</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">; Adjusted Diluted EPS was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$(0.48)</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:5px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total Available Liquidity increased to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$2.0 Billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">; Cash at Quarter End was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$1.4 Billion</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">SAN FRANCISCO (</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">July&#160;7, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">) </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8211; Levi Strauss&#160;&amp; Co. (NYSE: LEVI) today announced financial results for the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">May&#160;24, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:5px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The coincidence of the company&#8217;s fiscal quarter with the roughly ten-week duration of the temporary closure of the company&#8217;s and its customers&#8217; stores in response to the COVID-19 pandemic resulted in a significant adverse impact to revenues, earnings and cash flows. As stores have reopened, performance has trended better than the company&#8217;s expectations.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">-Quarter </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Results</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net revenues declined </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">62 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;on a reported basis; the decrease was due to the temporary closure of company-operated, franchise and wholesale customer retail locations as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, partially offset by the company&#8217;s e-commerce business which grew 25 percent for the quarter, with sequential month-over-month acceleration to nearly 80 percent growth for the month of May.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gross margin decreased 19.2 percentage points on a reported basis to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">34.1 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">; the decrease in gross margin was primarily due to inventory costs of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$87 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;recorded in connection with COVID-19 business disruptions. Adjusted gross margin was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">51.5 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, a decline of only 180 basis points, primarily reflecting lower wholesale gross margins, due to a higher proportion of Europe&#8217;s sales in lower margin markets and channels, which was partially offset by the benefit of price increases. Global DTC and the Americas' adjusted gross margins were in-line with prior year, and Asia's rose due to China's strong gross margin.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">SG&amp;A declined 14 percent to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$551 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, as the company&#8217;s cost-savings actions drove a 25 percent reduction in Adjusted SG&amp;A, which was partially offset by </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$88 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;of COVID-19 related charges.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The company recorded a net loss for the quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$364 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, reflecting </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$242 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, pre-tax, in restructuring charges and inventory costs and other charges recorded in connection with COVID-19 business disruptions, and an Adjusted net loss of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$192 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, primarily resulting from the temporary closures of company-operated, franchise and wholesale customer third-party retail locations.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBIT was a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$206 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, as the adverse revenue impact of COVID-19 was only partially offset by the company&#8217;s cost-savings actions, which drove a </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$157 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;decline in Adjusted SG&amp;A.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted diluted EPS was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$(0.48)</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">, reflecting the Adjusted net loss. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total inventories at quarter end increased ten percent, net of reserves, compared to a year prior, despite the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">62 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;decline in revenues, reflecting the company&#8217;s aggressive inventory actions in response to the COVID-19 business disruption and flexibility resulting from the high percentage of sales derived from core products.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The company enhanced its liquidity position by issuing an additional $500 million in aggregate principal amount of its 5.00% senior notes due 2025; total liquidity was $2 billion at quarter-end.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;We started the year with strong momentum, but the global pandemic and economic crises had a significantly negative impact on our second quarter results, as our stores and most wholesale doors were closed around the world for the majority of the quarter.  I&#8217;m proud of how the team stepped up in response,  accelerating our activation of key e-commerce and omni-channel capabilities, proactively cutting costs and managing cash smartly, and finding innovative ways to connect the Levi&#8217;s brand with its fans,&#8221; said </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Chip Bergh, president and chief executive officer of Levi Strauss &amp; Co</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">.  &#8220;As part of our response, to enable us to become a leaner and more market-responsive organization, as well as give us greater confidence in our cost structure given the uncertainties around the impact of the virus, we have made the difficult decision to reduce our non-retail, non-manufacturing workforce by about 700 positions, or roughly 15 percent, which we expect will generate annualized savings of $100 million.&#8221; </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Bergh continued, &#8220;the pandemic is accelerating retail landscape shifts and consumer behavior in ways that play to the strength of the Levi&#8217;s brand.  And we are doubling down on our digital transformation, incorporating the power of AI and data science, and leveraging our iconic brands to have an even stronger focus on Gen Z and sustainability.  We believe this will enable us to further grow our market leadership position and emerge from this crisis a stronger company.&#8221; </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;It&#8217;s been an unprecedented quarter, and we have been swift and agile in responding to the impact of the pandemic on our business,&#8221; said </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Harmit Singh, executive vice president and chief financial officer of Levi Strauss &amp; Co</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">.  &#8220;We have taken measures to improve the structural economics of our company, prudently manage inventories and further solidify liquidity.  As a result of our actions, in the second quarter, we increased total liquidity to $2 billion, reduced Adjusted SG&amp;A by </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$157 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and managed inventories to only a ten-percent increase over prior year.  We are encouraged by early signs of recovery, as roughly 90 percent of our company-operated and franchisee doors have now reopened globally, with nearly 40 percent of our company-operated stores comping positive as we exited the month, which in combination with our cost and working capital actions resulted in positive cash flow generation in June.  We are confident that the steps we are taking to sustainably reduce our costs and drive greater efficiencies in working capital will enable us to further expand Adjusted EBIT margins and drive cash flows as we emerge from the crisis.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">COVID-19 Update</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In mid-March, in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the substantial majority of the company&#8217;s and its franchise and wholesale customers&#8217; retail locations temporarily closed in the Americas and Europe, as well as in most of Asia outside greater China and Korea.  By the end of May, only a portion of these doors had reopened, and with a wide variation in level of sales productivity as compared to prior year, depending on local market conditions.  The coincidence of the company&#8217;s fiscal second quarter with the roughly ten-week duration of the temporary closures resulted in a significant adverse impact to revenues, earnings and cash flows.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In response to the pandemic and the uncertainty of its duration, the company took several measures to respond.  It accelerated the deployment of several omni-channel initiatives including virtual concierge, ship from store, buy online pick up in store, and continued the roll out of its mobile app and loyalty program to augment its direct-to-consumer business. To reduce its costs and streamline operations, the company implemented cost-reduction and inventory-management initiatives that the company expects will support its objective to expand Adjusted EBIT margins over time. It enhanced its liquidity position by issuing an additional $500 million of its 5.00% senior notes due 2025. These actions resulted in $2 billion of liquidity at the end of the second quarter. The company&#8217;s goal is to become a stronger, more profitable company coming out of this unprecedented crisis.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In addition to the adverse impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on the company&#8217;s second quarter financial results, the company recorded </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$242 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in incremental charges taken in connection with the pandemic.  The </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$242 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was comprised of incremental COVID-19 related inventory costs of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$87 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$88 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of other charges for customer receivables and asset impairments, and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$67 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of charges related to restructuring actions which the company anticipates will generate annualized cost savings of approximately $100 million.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Currently, roughly 90 percent of company-operated doors and franchisee doors have reopened globally, as well as the majority of third-party retail locations. While traffic and sales remain down to prior year, weekly sales performance in company-operated doors is sequentially improving, as store sales productivity in the final week of June as compared to prior year approached 80 percent, with nearly 40 percent of open company-operated store locations delivering positive net revenues growth compared to the same week in the prior year.  As store locations have reopened, the company&#8217;s e-commerce net revenues growth has remained strong, at nearly 70 percent growth for the month of June as compared to the same month in the prior year.  Cash flow trends are also improving, as net cash flows from operations were positive in June.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Although trends appear to be improving sequentially, the ultimate health and economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic remains highly uncertain.  The company expects that its business and results of operations, including net revenues, earnings and cash flows, will continue to be significantly adversely impacted for at least the balance of 2020, and there remains the possibility of additional COVID-19 related inventory and other charges.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">-Quarter Total Company Overview</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="23"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:32%;"></td><td displayed in cents</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Net revenues</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;declined </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">62 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a reported basis, and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">61 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a constant-currency basis excluding </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$41 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in unfavorable currency effects. The decrease was primarily due to the temporary closures of company-operated and third-party retail locations as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The decrease was partially offset by 25 percent growth in its company-operated e-commerce business, including the benefit of accelerating its omni-channel initiatives, which after declining in March began to recover in April and accelerated to nearly 80 percent growth in May compared to the same month of the prior year.  Company-operated e-commerce comprised 15 percent of total company net revenues in the second quarter, compared to 5 percent in the second quarter of the prior year, and growing at a faster rate due to the company&#8217;s digital initiatives and the pandemic&#8217;s impact to consumer shopping behaviors.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Gross profit</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$170 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$700 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the same quarter in the prior year. Gross margin was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">34 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of net revenues, down from </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">53 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the same quarter of the prior year. The decrease in gross profit and gross margin is primarily due to lower revenues across all regions and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$87 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in inventory-related costs recorded in connection with COVID-19 business disruptions, including the recognition of incremental inventory reserves of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$50 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and adverse fabric purchase commitments of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$36 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, directly related to the expected impact of COVID-19 on forecasted sales and expected selling prices. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted gross margin</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, which excludes the COVID-19 related charges, was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">51.5 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, a decline of 180 basis points compared to prior year, reflecting a decline in Europe&#8217;s wholesale gross margin, as the benefit of price increases was more than offset by a higher proportion of sales in lower-margin markets and channels.  Gross margins for global DTC as well as for the Americas region were in line with the same quarter in the prior year, and Asia&#8217;s gross margin rose due to the benefit of price increases and a higher proportion of sales in China.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Selling, general and administrative (SG&amp;A) expenses</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$551 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, a 14 percent decline compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$638 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the same quarter in the prior year.  SG&amp;A in the second quarter of 2020 included COVID-19 related non-cash charges of $60 million in asset impairments primarily associated with the company&#8217;s store fleet and charges of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$28 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;related to customer receivables. </font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted SG&amp;A</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the second quarter declined $157 million to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$462 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, 25 percent lower than </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$619 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the same quarter in the prior year, reflecting substantial decreases in selling expenses, advertising, administration costs and distribution, all in connection with COVID-19 and the company&#8217;s related cost-reduction initiatives. </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Restructuring charges </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$67 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were recorded in the second quarter of 2020 in connection with the company&#8217;s restructuring initiative, which is designed to reduce costs, streamline operations and support agility. The action the company announced today includes an approximately 15 percent reduction of the company's global non-retail and non-manufacturing organization, or roughly 700 positions, and is anticipated to be substantially completed in 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating loss </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$448 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;reflected lower Adjusted EBIT as well as the recognition of $67 million of restructuring charges, </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$87 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of COVID-19 related inventory costs and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$88 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of COVID-19 related other charges for customer receivables and asset impairments. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBIT</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$206 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, reflecting the adverse revenue impact of COVID-19, which was partially offset by the company&#8217;s cost-reduction initiatives.  </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted net loss</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font Adjusted EBIT.  </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;padding-left:24px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">* Note: Regional operating income is equal to regional Adjusted EBIT. </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Americas</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, net revenues declined </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">59 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a reported basis. The decrease in net revenues was across channels and brands due to the impacts of COVID-19 and the temporary closure of company-operated and third-party retail locations across the region. The majority of these locations closed mid-March and remained closed through the end of the quarter. The decrease in net revenues was partially offset by growth in e-commerce revenue; after an initial slowdown in response to COVID-19, online traffic on the company&#8217;s e-commerce websites increased partway through the quarter, accelerating through May in which U.S. company-operated e-commerce net revenues grew more than 100 percent compared to the same month of the prior year.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Operating loss for the Americas was due to the adverse impacts of COVID-19, as lower net revenues were only partially offset by declines in discretionary and variable SG&amp;A expenses driven by the company&#8217;s cost reduction initiatives in response to COVID-19.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Europe</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, net revenues declined </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">68 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a reported basis. Net revenues decreased due to the impact of COVID-19, with the exception of the e-commerce business, where increasing growth rates accelerated to 35 percent growth in May after an initial slowdown in response to COVID-19.  Company-operated and third-party retail locations began to close mid-March, with some markets reopening by the end of April and others during the month of May.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Europe's operating loss was due to the adverse impacts of COVID-19, as lower net revenues were only partially offset by declines in discretionary and variable SG&amp;A expenses driven by the company&#8217;s cost reduction initiatives in response to COVID-19.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Asia</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, net revenues decreased </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">61 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a reported basis. The decrease in net revenues was across channels due to the impacts of COVID-19 and the temporary closures of company operated and third-party retail locations in the region. Retail locations in China and the neighboring countries that were impacted earlier by COVID-19 began to reopen their doors mid-March and saw foot traffic improve sequentially during the quarter, whereas locations in the rest of the region closed mid-March and remained closed through the end of the second quarter. E-commerce revenue grew significantly driven by increased traffic.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;padding-left:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Asia's operating loss was due to the adverse impacts of COVID-19, as lower net revenues were only partially offset by declines in discretionary and variable SG&amp;A expenses driven by the company&#8217;s cost reduction initiatives in response to COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Year-to-date </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Results</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;are included in the company&#8217;s Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended May 24, 2020.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash Flow and Balance Sheet </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;at the end of the second quarter of 2020 of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$1,448 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and short-term investments of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$76 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were complemented by </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$448 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;available under the company's revolving credit facility, resulting in a </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">total liquidity position</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of approximately </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$2.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. To further increase liquidity and strengthen the balance sheet, during the quarter the company drew down $300 million on its senior secured revolving credit facility and issued an additional $500 million in aggregate principal amount of its 5.00% senior notes due 2025, some or all of which the company may redeem at once or over time, at redemption prices specified in the indenture governing the notes.  Subsequent to quarter end, the company repaid the $300 million drawn on its credit facility, reflecting the company&#8217;s strong liquidity position and confidence in its ability to draw on the facility in the future if necessary.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Net debt</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;at the end of the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$283 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">.  The company&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">leverage ratio</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">4.1</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;at the end of the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, an increase as compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">1.4</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;at the end of the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, due to the increase in gross debt and adverse impact of COVID-19 on the company&#8217;s Adjusted EBIT.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash from operations</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;months of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;decreased to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$41 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$162 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;months of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, reflecting the significant impact of the widespread temporary store closures and other significant adverse impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. The adverse impact on cash from operations related to COVID-19 was partially mitigated by the company&#8217;s focus on working capital management, in particular managing inventories, including reducing and canceling inventory commitments and redeploying basic inventory items to subsequent seasons, as well as negotiating extended payment terms with suppliers, vendors and landlords, and vigorously pursuing collection of receivables.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted free cash flow</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the first </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;months of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$(214) million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, a decline of $253 million compared to the first six months of 2019, primarily reflecting lower cash from operations and higher share repurchases.  The company has suspended its share repurchase program, and as it exited the second quarter had returned to positive cash flow generation.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Total inventories</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were up ten percent compared to the end of the corresponding prior-year period, despite the sales decline of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">62 percent</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, reflecting the swift actions the company took to curtail inventory inflow. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The company declared and paid </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">dividends</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$0.08</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per share in the second quarter totaling approximately $32 million. Collectively, dividends for the first and second quarter of 2020 represent a 16 percent increase compared to the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;">$55 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;paid in the first half of 2019. The company has determined not to declare a dividend for the third quarter and will reassess dividend payments for the fourth quarter as circumstances evolve.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Additional information regarding net debt, leverage ratio and Adjusted free cash flow, non-GAAP financial measures, is provided at the end of this press release.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Annual Guidance</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Given the ongoing substantial uncertainty resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic and related economic impact, the company has withdrawn all guidance provided on January 30, 2020, and is not providing further guidance at this time.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Investor Conference Call</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The company&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">-quarter </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;investor conference call will be available through a live audio webcast at </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0563c1;text-decoration:underline;">https://engage.vevent.com/rt/levistraussco/index.jsp?seid=80</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">July&#160;7, 2020</font><font
